page.title: 13Laverbread - local delicacy
page.content: A famous local delicacy sold in Swansea market is{laverbread}or{bara {lawr}which is made from boiled and chopped{seaweed.} The edible seaweed used to be collected locally but coastal pollution has put a stop to this and supplies are now brought from Pembrokeshire and Scotland. The laverbread is greenish-black in colour and when it is eaten raw people compare it with the taste of caviare. However the traditional way of eating it is to shape it into small cakes, roll them in oatmeal and fry in bacon fat. In recent years a local restaurant owner has started canning laverbread, hoping to encourage people in the rest of Britain and even abroad to develop a taste for it.
